Description: Pottery sherd from a rounded cup painted with yellow, white and red paint. Made from Egyptian clay in Middle Minoan II style.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Nile silt fabric. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 124
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A567)
Kemp & Merrillees 1980 / Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt (Ka.26) (p. 75)
